title: How to Disable Google Assistant on Android

steps.title: Open the Google app.
steps.content: Open the Google app. This app icon looks like a multicolored "G." This method will completely disable and turn off Google Assistant. After you do this, some apps and features, like Google Weather on your Home screen, or voice dialing, will no longer work. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Tap your profile picture.
steps.content: Tap your profile picture. A menu will pop up in the middle of your screen.

steps.title: Tap Settings.
steps.content: Tap Settings . It's next to a gear icon near the bottom of the menu.

steps.title: Tap Google Assistant.
steps.content: Tap Google Assistant . You'll see this next to the dots that represent the Google Assistant icon near the middle of the menu.

steps.title: Tap General.
steps.content: Tap General . You'll probably have to scroll down the menu a bit to find it under the "All settings" header. It's next to an icon of a gear.

steps.title: Tap the toggle next to "Google Assistant" to switch it off .
steps.content: Tap the toggle next to "Google Assistant" to switch it off . When the feature is disabled, the switch is grey. A grey switch means Google Assistant will not appear ever, even if you try to open the Assistant app. [2] X Research source [3] X Research source

steps.title: Open Settings on your Android.
steps.content: Open Settings on your Android. You'll find this gear icon in the Quick settings panel if you swipe down from the top of the screen. Another option is to find the gear app icon on your Home screen and tap it. This will remove the functionality of the keys/buttons/phrases used to summon the voice assistant, like the long-press Home button. You can still use the voice assistant within the Assistant app, however.

steps.title: Tap Apps.
steps.content: Tap Apps . You might see "Apps & Notifications" instead.

steps.title: Tap Default apps.
steps.content: Tap Default apps . According to the model of your phone, you may see something similar to "Default apps." On Samsungs, you'll see "Choose default apps" at the top of the menu. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Assist and voice input.
steps.content: Tap Assist and voice input . The wording here will vary based on your phone's manufacturer and model, but it will be a similar option. Samsung, for example, will list "Digital assistant app" instead. Tap that to continue.

steps.title: Tap Device assistance app.
steps.content: Tap Device assistance app . This might also say "Default assistant app." Tap that to continue.

steps.title: Tap None to select it.
steps.content: Tap None to select it. Any changes will be saved automatically, so you can close Settings after changing this option. You've turned off the default assistant, so the normal ways of opening it are disabled. [5] X Research source You can, however, still interact with Google Assistant in the Assistant app. [6] X Research source
